src:
全日空、パイロット不足で成田国際線を減便へ

02 Nov 2019, 07:56

　全日本空輸が成田空港発着の国際便について、来年３月から、１日の運航便の２割に当たる１０便程度を減便する方向で調整に入ったことがわかった。羽田空港発着の国際便を同月から増やすことでパイロット不足に陥る恐れが出たためだ。日本航空も成田便の減便を検討しているとみられる。訪日客の増加で航空需要が高まる中、大手航空会社が国内拠点空港の発着便を大幅に減らすのは異例だ。
１日１０便程度を検討
　来年の東京五輪・パラリンピックを控え、羽田では、同年３月に東京都心上空を飛ぶ新ルートが導入され、日中の国際線の発着数が年６万回から９万９０００回に増える。これに伴い、国土交通省は今年９月、全日空に１日当たり１３・５便、日本航空に同１１・５便の発着枠を新たに割り当てた。
　複数の関係者によると、全日空は羽田の増便に向けてパイロットの調整を進めてきたが、増便の主力となる長距離路線は３人が乗務する必要があるほか、主に使われる大型機の操縦資格を持つ者も限られ、人繰りが難しくなったという。このため成田を１日に発着する国際線４２便（平均）のうち、１０便ほどを減らし、羽田に回す検討を始めた。
　成田を巡っては、米デルタ航空が来年３月に撤退し、羽田に日米路線を集約することを決めるなど地位低下を懸念する声も上がっている。全日空は羽田、成田双方を首都圏のハブ（拠点）空港と位置づける考えを示しているが、関係者は「より都心に近い羽田に一時的に比重を移さなければならなくなった」と話す。
　これに対し、ある政府関係者は「首都圏の航空需要を支えるため両空港が発展する必要があるのに、羽田の機能強化で成田便を削っては元も子もない」と語る。
　一方、日航は来年３月以降、成田で米サンフランシスコ線を新規就航させる計画もあるが、関係者によると、一部路線での減便を検討しているという。
text:
ANA to reduce flights to Narita International due to pilot shortage

02 Nov 2019, 07:56

It was found that all Nippon Airways started to adjust international flights to / from Narita Airport from March next year in the direction of reducing about 10 flights, which is 20% of the daily flights. This is because the number of international flights to and from Haneda Airport increased from the same month, and there was a risk of pilot shortages. Japan Airlines seems to be considering reducing Narita flights. It is unusual for major airlines to drastically reduce arrivals and departures at domestic base airports as the demand for air travel rises due to an increase in visitors to Japan.
Consider about 10 flights a day
In preparation for next year's Tokyo Olympics and Paralympics, Haneda will introduce a new route to fly over central Tokyo in March of the same year, increasing the number of arrivals and departures of international flights between Japan and China from 60,000 times to 99,000 times a year. In connection with this, the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism newly allocated slots for 13.5 flights per day to ANA and 11.5 flights to Japan Airlines in September this year.
According to several officials, ANA has been adjusting pilots to increase Haneda flights, but long-haul routes, which are the mainstay of increased flights, require three passengers to ride, as well as large aircraft used mainly. The number of people who have qualifications for maneuvering is limited, and it is said that it has become difficult to carry people. For this reason, we started a study to reduce the number of international flights departing from and arriving at Narita on a daily basis by about 10 flights to Haneda.
As for Narita, Delta Airlines withdrew in March next year, and there are also voices concerned about a decline in status, such as deciding to consolidate Japan-US routes to Haneda. ANA shows that Haneda and Narita are both considered as hub airports in the Tokyo metropolitan area, but officials said that they had to temporarily move their weight to Haneda, which is closer to the city center.
“On the other hand, a government official said,“ Even though both airports need to develop to support aviation demand in the Tokyo metropolitan area, there is no one or two children to cut off Narita flights with the enhancement of Haneda functions. ”
On the other hand, Nikko has plans to launch a new San Francisco route in Narita after March next year, but according to officials, it is considering reducing flights on some routes.
